Show Details

Description:

1726 BIBLE Theodore Beza Huguenot Latin New Testament Protestant Reformation

Theodore Beza was one of the most prolific French Protestants during the Reformation. In 1565, Beza first issued an edition of the Greek New Testament translated into the Vulgate. His biblical translations were extremely important and popular throughout Europe, especially among Calvinists and helped shape many theological scholars who came after him.

This 1726 Midwinter Latin edition of Beza's New Testament was published in London.

Item number: #12567

Price: $499

Description:

1707 1ed Kromayer German Bible & Commentary & Scripture Memory Concordance RARE

"Dispositiones Memoriales librorum" is a rare, early 18th-century Bible commentary and instructional book written by Johann Abraham Kromayer. This work features scriptures adapted in a manner that allows for easier memory. This edition, published in 1707 by Crocker contains a thorough and detailed Bible Concordance.

Description:

1738 BIBLE Book of Common Prayer Illustrated Baskett + Psalms of David Anglican

In 1712, John Baskett began printing the Book of Common Prayer, shortly after the success of the 1710 New Testament. Baskett was the printer to the king during the first half of the 18th-century. This edition is bound with 'A Companion to the Altar' – an important supplement to the 'Book of Common Prayer'. It helps clarify and manage the Holy Sacraments, prayers, meditations, and aspects of worship in the Church of England.

This impressive tome features exquisite full-page engravings of portraits of saints and Bible scenes.

Item number: #19773

Price: $750

Description:

1796 PURITAN John Flavel Token for Mourners AMERICAN Bible Devotional on Death

John Flavel was a 17th-century Presbyterian and Puritan author. He has written numerous important books, many of which include his full sermons. Flavel was a proponent of Monergism (the concept of salvation without the individual's own belief), which appeared throughout Flavel's works. One such work was 'Token for Mourners'. In this book, Flavel offers direction on spiritual and emotional healing following death based on how Mary, the mother of Jesus, dealt with the loss of her son.

This particular edition is noteworthy for being an early American edition. Newbury, Vermont was not considered a major hub of American printing; as such, this work is considered to be quite rare and valuable.

Item number: #19990

Price: $599

FLAVEL, John

A token for mourners, or, The advice of Christ to a distressed mother, bewailing the death of her dear and only son

Les Psaumes de David : Mis en Vers François.

by PELLET, Pierre

Used

near fine

Hardcover

Show Details

Description:

1745 Geneva Huguenot Bible Psalms of David Music French Chant Pellet Switzerland

A very rare and highly desirable 18th-century printing of the Psalms of David each set to vocal chant music. Presumably completed by the publisher Pierre Pellet, this edition was reviewed and edited by the Church of Geneva and published with each Psalm in French. Other Biblical texts are set to music in this book, including 'Nunc Dimittis', or 'Song of Simeon'

from Luke, as well as the Ten Commandments.

Item number: #20277

Price: $599

Used

Hardcover

Show Details

Description:

1547 Saint Anselm of Canterbury BIBLE Epistles of Paul Benedictine Scholasticism

"I believe in order that I may understand."

– Anselm of Canterbury

Saint Anselm of Canterbury was an 11th-century Benedictine monk and philosopher. While Anselm was relatively unknown and unrecognized for his philosophical views during his lifetime, he has since been considered the founder of scholasticism and writing about the existence of God in an academic manner rather than purely theological. The ODCC refers to Anselm as being 'the most luminous and penetrating intellect between St. Augustine and Thomas Aquinas…and the father of scholasticism'. Many of his writings set the stage for a European period of innovating logic, ethics, mysticism, and metaphysics.

This 1547 printing of the works of Anselm features his commentary on the Epistles of Paul.

Price: $950

Description:

1806 BIBLE Concordance Scottish Alexander Cruden KJV HUGE 1st US ed Philadelphia

Alexander Cruden was an 18th-century Scottish author who is primarily remembered for his famed bible concordance. This book, which is more commonly known as 'Cruden's Concordance', is a large, thorough concordance which has yet to be out of print since its first edition.

This 1806 Philadelphia edition is the first American edition of this famous concordance!

Item number: #21090

Price: $499

Catechetischer Hauss-Schatz, oder, Erklärung des Heidelbergischen Catechismi durch Frag und Antwort

by STAHELIN, Christoph

Used

near fine

Hardcover

Show Details

Description:

1771 Heidelberg Catechism Huguenot CALVINISM Basel Swiss Bible Reformed Theology

A rare explanation and commentary on the Heidelberg Catechism, published in 1771 in Basel. The Heidelberg Catechism was a Protestant treatise written in the 16th-century as a way to supplement teaching Reformed Christianity, Calvinistic doctrine. It outlines the fall of man, redemption of sin, justification of faith, and gratitude to be shown for that forgiveness. Scripture references are used throughout, along with important Christian sacraments and ceremonies.

Description:

1886 BIBLE Gallery Gustave Dore ART Illustrated Old/New Testament Bible Scenes

Gustave Dore first began publishing Bible illustrations in 1865 in France, but because of their immense popularity, they would see reissues for decades and all over the western world. Most of these large, multi-volume Bibles, that contained nearly 250 engravings, were too heavy and expensive for the common buyer, so smaller products were published that featured only illustrations and no Bible text. These became the 'Dore Bible Gallery' editions.

Dore's Bible illustrations had a direct effect on early 20th-century biblical based films, drawing influence and costume design from Dore's portrayal of Bible characters.

Item number: #22319

Price: $499

Description:

1904 Lmtd 1st ed Book Common Prayer Edward VII Church of England Psalms FOLIO

A scarcely printed and unique folio variant of "The Book of Common Prayer." This 1904 authorized first American edition of the prayer book of King Edward VII, outlines the Church of England's order of rituals, rites, ceremonies, as well as the administration of the sacraments. Additionally, the Psalms of David are included in a format designed to accommodate corporate song.

This edition was published under a joint arrangement involving the Essex House Press, the Guild of Handicraft, and M. Walter Dunne of New York. With intricate designs and typography by Charles Robert Ashbee, the book includes blue silk moiré endpapers, a woodcut frontispiece, title page with a woodcut border, historiated headpieces, initials, and illustrated tables. Printed in red and black throughout, it offers a visually stunning representation of the Church of England's religious text.

Item number: #41021

Price: $599

Description:

1686 Biblia Sacra Vulgate Holy BIBLE Sixtus V Apocrypha Guillimin Lyon France

A very rare, mid-17th-century Vulgate Biblia Sacra published in 1686 by Petri Guillimin. This edition contains a beautiful, engraved title page with allegorical Bible scenes. In addition to the Old and New Testaments, this edition contains books of the Apocrypha.
